post: Students learn the Constitution in class, but a physical copy makes it real. Now they have one thanks to your generosity.   Kyle M., Michigan educator $1 = 1 Pocket Constitution:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #SupportTeachers

📜  #OTD in 1837, Robert Gould Shaw was born. As commander of the 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment, the first Black regiment raised in the North, he led with courage and conviction. How does Shaws example invite students to reflect on moral leadership and sacrifice? 🔗  https://bit.ly/3WtjXBQ  #TDiH  #CivicVirtues  #AmericanHistory  #Leadership  #CivicEducation

As we look to Americas next 250 years, the Civic Star Challenge empowers students to live out constitutional principlesjustice, equality, libertyin their own communities. Teachers: join today! 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #America250  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice

How can we help middle schoolers see themselves as part of Americas story? 📚 Our new curriculum, Building a Self-Governing People, connects U. S. history and civics through Founding Principles and civic virtues, helping students understand what it means to sustain a free society. Explore the resource and share how your school approaches civic learning for grades 6–8: 🔗  https://bit.ly/4o9QJ6P  #CivicEducation  #MiddleSchool  #CivicLearning  #AmericanHistory  #TeachingResources

Who penned We the People ? Meet Gouverneur Morris, the Constitutions stylist and a major voice at the Philadelphia Convention. Dennis Rasmussen joins BRI to unpack Morriss ideas on Congress, the presidency, and the Preamble. Watch:  https://bit.ly/3IOFlP2  #CivicEducation  #AmericanFounding  #Constitution

⏳ Last chance! The Florida MyImpact Challenge Civics Fair is just days away. Students will showcase community service projects, pitch new ideas, and compete for $2,000 in prizes. Dont miss out, register before its too late:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #CivicEducation  #ServiceLearning

Civic Star themes bring civics into any classroom. From Equality  to Revolution & Change,  students discover history and connect it to today, while teachers compete for prizes. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4fOChOR  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #America250

Help us congratulate National Civic Teacher of the Year finalist Christian Wrabley (Greater Johnstown HS, PA)! He models civil dialogue, elevates student voice, and turns civics into action, from weekly voting to problem-solving that shapes school policy. 🔗  https://bit.ly/46EAid9  #CivicEducation  #CivilDialogue  #StudentVoice  #Leadership

The Civics Fair is about more than prizes, its about impact. Students will showcase service projects that strengthen communities and pitch ideas to solve real challenges. Join us Oct. 11 at UCF for the Florida MyImpact Challenge. Register today:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #ServiceLearning  #CommunityImpact

📜  #OTD in 1877, Chief Joseph of the Nez Perce surrendered to U. S. forces after months of resistance. His speech, I will fight no more forever,  remains one of the most powerful in American history. How can we help students understand this moment of loss and resilience? 🔗 Discover this lesson:  https://bit.ly/3KxzyxE  #TDiH  #NativeAmericanHistory  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory
